entry.string: Administration - Articles
entry.translation: Edmeenistreshun - Erteecles

entry.string: What is it?
entry.translation: Vhet is it?

entry.string: Articles is a Xaraya Content Module responsible for the handling of generic and complex content structures.
entry.translation: Erteecles is a Xereya Cuntent Mudoole-a respunseeble-a fur zee hundleeng ooff genereec und cumplex cuntent strooctoores. Um gesh dee bork, bork!

entry.string: How to use it?
entry.translation: Hoo tu use-a it?

entry.string: If this is your first visit to this part of your Xaraya site, please take a minute to read through the following introduction, in order to explore the different possibilities offered by the articles module.
entry.translation: Iff thees is yuoor furst feesit tu thees pert ooff yuoor Xereya seete-a, pleese-a teke-a a meenoote-a tu reed thruoogh zee fullooeeng intrudoocshun, in oorder tu ixplure-a zee deefffferent pusseebilities ooffffered by zee erteecles mudoole-a.

entry.string: 1. Publication types
entry.translation: 1. Poobleeceshun types

entry.string: The articles module can manage 'articles' of different types at the same time, for instance news articles, longer documents in different sections, frequently asked questions, and so on.
entry.translation: Zee erteecles mudoole-a cun munege-a 'erteecles' ooff deefffferent types et zee seme-a teeme-a, fur instunce-a noos erteecles, lunger ducooments in deefffferent secshuns, freqooently esked qooesshuns, und su oon. Bork bork bork!

entry.string: These types are called 'publication types', and each type of article can make use of a different set of data fields, with a different meaning for each data field. For example, the 'summary' field could be used for an Introduction in news articles, for providing some details about a question in FAQs, or not be used at all for section documents.
entry.translation: Zeese-a types ere-a celled 'poobleeceshun types', und iech type-a ooff erteecle-a cun meke-a use-a ooff a deefffferent set ooff deta feeelds, veet a deefffferent meuneeng fur iech deta feeeld. Fur ixemple-a, zee 'soommery' feeeld cuoold be-a used fur un Intrudoocshun in noos erteecles, fur prufeeding sume-a deteeels ebuoot a qooesshun in FEQs, oor nut be-a used et ell fur secshun ducooments.

entry.string: There is a specific menu where you can manage those publication types, change the description that will appear in navigation menus, enable and disable data fields or change their meaning for a particular type, or even create or delete publication types according to your needs.
entry.translation: Zeere-a is a speceeffic menoo vhere-a yuoo cun munege-a thuse-a poobleeceshun types, chunge-a zee descreepshun thet veell eppeer in nefeegeshun menoos, ineble-a und deeseble-a deta feeelds oor chunge-a zeeur meuneeng fur a perteecooler type-a, oor ifee creete-a oor delete-a poobleeceshun types eccurdeeng tu yuoor needs.

entry.string: Each publication type also has its own templates, so that you can customize the look & feel of how each article will appear to your visitors.
entry.translation: Eech poobleeceshun type-a elsu hes its oovn templetes, su thet yuoo cun coostumeeze-a zee luuk & feel ooff hoo iech erteecle-a veell eppeer tu yuoor feesiturs. Um gesh dee bork, bork!

entry.string: A default set of publication types and templates (corresponding to the old News, Sections and FAQs modules, if you're familiar with earlier versions of PostNuke or PHP-Nuke) is included as part of the installation.
entry.translation: A deffoolt set ooff poobleeceshun types und templetes (currespundeeng tu zee oold Noos, Secshuns und FEQs mudooles, iff yuoo're-a femeelier veet ierleeer ferseeuns ooff PustNooke-a oor PHP-Nooke-a) is inclooded es pert ooff zee instelleshun.

entry.string: 2. Categories
entry.translation: 2. Cetegureees

entry.string: Articles (of any type) can be organised into categories. You could use one or more common categories across different publication types, or use specific categories for each type of article, or any combination that you might prefer for your site.
entry.translation: Erteecles (ooff uny type-a) cun be-a oorguneesed intu cetegureees. Um gesh dee bork, bork! Yuoo cuoold use-a oone-a oor mure-a cummun cetegureees ecruss deefffferent poobleeceshun types, oor use-a speceeffic cetegureees fur iech type-a ooff erteecle-a, oor uny cumbeeneshun thet yuoo meeght preffer fur yuoor seete-a.

entry.string: Before you start specifying which article types will be using what categories, you should create the categorization you want via the Categories administration menu. A default set of categories has been defined for articles when you installed this module, as an example to get you started. (You can adapt the categories later on, of course.)
entry.translation: Beffure-a yuoo stert speceeffying vheech erteecle-a types veell be-a useeng vhet cetegureees, yuoo shuoold creete-a zee cetegureezeshun yuoo vunt feea zee Ceteguries edmeenistreshun menu. Hurty flurty schnipp schnipp! A deffoolt set ooff cetegureees hes beee deffeened fur erteecles vhee yuoo instelled thees mudoole-a, es un ixemple-a tu get yuoo sterted. (Yuoo cun edept zee cetegureees leter oon, ooff cuoorse-a.)

entry.string: Once you have a set of categories you would like to use for your articles, you can go to Articles Configuration, and specify the number of categories that can be used for each publication type, and the 'base categories' to be used.
entry.translation: Once-a yuoo hefe-a a set ooff cetegureees yuoo vuoold leeke-a tu use-a fur yuoor erteecles, yuoo cun gu tu Erteecles Cunffeegooreshun, und speceeffy zee noomber ooff cetegureees thet cun be-a used fur iech poobleeceshun type-a, und zee 'bese-a cetegureees' tu be-a used. Bork bork bork!

entry.string: A 'base category' is any starting point somewhere in your tree of categories, below which you will have the actual list (or subtree) of categories people can choose from when they submit or view articles. For example, you could have a 'base category' called Topics, with a list of different topics relevant to your site below it, and another 'base category' called Cities, with a list of cities or places that you would provide regional news for.
entry.translation: A 'bese-a cetegury' is uny sterteeng pueent sumoohere-a in yuoor tree-a ooff cetegureees, beloo vheech yuoo veell hefe-a zee ectooel leest (oor soobtree-a) ooff cetegureees peuple-a cun chuuse-a frum vhee zeey soobmeet oor feeoo erteecles. Um gesh dee bork, bork! Fur ixemple-a, yuoo cuoold hefe-a a 'bese-a cetegury' celled Tupeecs, veet a leest ooff deefffferent tupeecs relefunt tu yuoor seete-a beloo it, und unuzeer 'bese-a cetegury' celled Ceeties, veet a leest ooff ceeties oor pleces thet yuoo vuoold prufeede-a regeeunel noos fur. Hurty flurty schnipp schnipp!

entry.string: One topic might be 'Good Restaurants', and one city might 'Brussels', so people would be able to browse through any articles about good restaurants in Brussels, for instance.
entry.translation: One-a tupeec meeght be-a 'Guud Restoorunts', und oone-a ceety meeght 'Broossels', su peuple-a vuoold be-a eble-a tu broose-a thruoogh uny erteecles ebuoot guud restoorunts in Broossels, fur instunce-a.

entry.string: 3. Submitting or adding articles
entry.translation: 3. Soobmeetting oor eddeeng erteecles

entry.string: status = submitted, rejected, approved or on frontpage (for those pubtypes that use it !)
entry.translation: stetoos = soobmeetted, rejected, epprufed oor oon fruntpege-a (fur thuse-a poobtypes thet use-a it !)

entry.string: 4. Managing the overview and display of articles per publication type
entry.translation: 4. Munegeeng zee ooferfeeoo und deespley ooff erteecles per poobleeceshun type

entry.string: In Articles Configuration, set start view (list/browse), # of columns and items, show category links + # of comments (+ performance impact)
entry.translation: In Erteecles Cunffeegooreshun, set stert feeoo (leest/broose-a), # ooff culoomns und items, shoo cetegury leenks + # ooff cumments (+ perffurmunce-a impect)

entry.string: + adapt specific templates!
entry.translation: + edept speceeffic templetes!

entry.string: 5. Managing your 'front page'
entry.translation: 5. Munegeeng yuoor 'ffrunt pege'

entry.string: cfr. frontpage status and # of columns and items - needs to be extended
entry.translation: cffr. Hurty flurty schnipp schnipp! fruntpege-a stetoos und # ooff culoomns und items - needs tu be-a ixtended

entry.string: 6. Adding counters, ratings, comments, smilies, bb-code etc.
entry.translation: 6. Eddeeng cuoonters, reteengs, cumments, smeelies, bb-cude-a itc.

entry.string: cfr. hooks + special note on counters
entry.translation: cffr. huuks + speceeel nute-a oon cuoonters

entry.string: 7. Organising permissions
entry.translation: 7. Oorguneesing permeessiuns

entry.string: this really needs a permissions wizard
entry.translation: thees reelly needs a permeessiuns veezerd

entry.string: 8. Short URL support
entry.translation: 8. Shurt URL sooppurt

entry.string: overall enable/disable in 'base' admin + specific enable/disable in 'articles' admin + use of module aliases
entry.translation: oferell ineble-a/deeseble-a in 'bese' edmeen + speceeffic ineble-a/deeseble-a in 'erteecles' edmeen + use-a ooff mudoole-a eleeeses

entry.string: Module aliases seem to be disabled at the moment - uncomment the line in includes/xarServer.php if you want to try it out
entry.translation: Mudoole-a eleeeses seem tu be-a deesebled et zee mument - uncumment zee leene-a in includes/xarServer.php iff yuoo vunt tu try it oooot

entry.string: Included Blocks
entry.translation: Inclooded Blucks

entry.string: big
entry.translation: beeg

entry.string: featured items
entry.translation: feetoored items

entry.string: glossary
entry.translation: glussery

entry.string: past
entry.translation: pest

entry.string: random
entry.translation: rundum

entry.string: related
entry.translation: releted

entry.string: top items
entry.translation: tup items

entry.string: Included Hooks
entry.translation: Inclooded Huuks

entry.string: Search hook which provides the functionality to search your individual articles.
entry.translation: Seerch huuk vheech prufeedes zee fooncshuneleety tu seerch yuoor indeefidooel erteecles. Um gesh dee bork, bork!
